software_module_type.description: A Python implementation of a Proportional-Integral-Derivative controller for ROS

windup_limit.description: The maximum limit for error integral

deadband_width.description: Control efforts with an absolute value below this values will be ignored and a 0 will be sent instead

variable.description: The variable on which this loop operates. This parameter is used to rename the input and outputs of this module for easy integration for the inputs and outputs of firmware modules. For example if the `variable` were `air_temperature`, `desired` would become `air_temperature_desired`, `state` would become `air_temperature`, `cmd` would become `air_temperature_cmd`, `up_cmd` would become `air_temperature_up_cmd`, and `down_cmd` would become `air_temperature_down_cmd

desired.description: The message data element must contain the desired value of the state measurement of the controlled process. This topic can be renamed by the variable parameter

state.description: The message data element must contain the current value of the controlled plant property. The controller publishes std_msgs/Float64 messages on the control_effort topic each time it receives a message on the state topic. Thus the rate at which the plant publishes state governs the control-loop rate - the plant should publish state at the desired loop rate. This topic can be renamed by the topic_from_plant parameter

cmd.description: The control_effort message data element contains the control effort to be applied to the process to drive state/data to equal setpoint/data. This topic can be renamed by the topic_from_controller parameter

software_module_type.description: Reads diagnostic information coming from the arduino, converts the status codes to status messages using configuration information from the database, and republishes the information

The usb_cam_node interfaces with standard USB cameras (e.g. the Logitech Quickcam) using libusb_cam and publishes images as sensor_msgs::Image. Uses the image_transport library to allow compressed image transport.
